meanings.definition: A person who grows or sells cedar trees.
meanings.sent1: The cedarier at the nursery helped me choose the perfect cedar tree for my garden.
meanings.sent2: The cedarier's knowledge of cedar trees is unmatched in the region.
meanings.sent3: The cedarier joked that the cedar trees in the garden were having a party when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The cedarier's passion for cedar trees is as deep-rooted as the trees themselves.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the cedarier's advice on caring for my cedar tree.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of cedar, meaning more like cedar.
meanings.sent1: The cedarier scent of the new candle filled the room with a refreshing aroma.
meanings.sent2: The cedarier wood used in the furniture gave it a natural and earthy feel.
meanings.sent3: The cedarier paint color on the walls made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a cedarier tone when she spoke about her love for nature.
meanings.sent5: The cedarier texture of the fabric reminded me of the forest floor.
